data.text:
An English actress, presenter, and celebrity chef named Lisa Tamsin Faulkner is known professionally as Lisa Faulkner. As the host of the cooking show “What’s Cooking?” on British television, she is well known in the United Kingdom.

She made her acting debut as Helene Lagonelle in the 1992 drama film The Lover, as well as as Alison Dangerfield in the drama series Dangerfield, which ran for 18 episodes.

She triumphed on the reality cooking competition “Celebrity Masterchef” in 2010. Lisa frequently uses social media and has over 297 thousand followers on Instagram.

Is Lisa Faulkner married? Relationship

Lisa Faulkner has a satisfying marriage. She has been dating Australian chef John Torode since 2015. On October 24, 2019, the couple said “I do” at Aynhoe Park in Oxfordshire. They were still married to their previous partners when they met on the stage of Celebrity MasterChef in 2010.

In 2015, John asked Lisa out on a date. Four years later, in 2019, they tied the knot at Aynhoe Park in Oxfordshire in front of their loved ones. A pre-wedding lunch was held on the evening of their big day, and their wedding celebrations lasted for two days.

Lisa identifies as heterosexual. She also married Chris Coghill in 2005 and the two adopted a 15-month-old baby in 2006. However, the couple divorced and separated in 2011.

How did Lisa Faulkner begin her professional career?

In 1992’s “The Lover,” Lisa Faulkner made her acting debut. At the age of 23, she was cast as Alison Dangerfield in the British television drama “Dangerfield.” Lisa Faulkner began her modeling career at the age of 16.

She subsequently played the lead role in the British films A Feast at Midnight in 1995 and And the Beat Goes On in 1996.

She played Louise Hope in the Channel 4 soap opera Brookside from 1999 to 2001, as well as Dr Victoria Merrick in Holby City.

She voiced DS Emma Scribbins in the ITV drama Death in Suburbia in 2004 and served as narrator for the BBC One series Heir Hunters from June 2008 to June 2009.

She also spoke regularly at Amanda Redman’s Artists’ Theatre School. Faulkner was included among FHM’s “100 Sexiest Ladies in the World” six times between 1999 and 2004.

Lisa was a frequent contributor to Big Brother’s Little Brother, Angela and Friends, The Wright Thing and the magazine show on Sky 1 and Channel 1.

In addition to winning Celebrity Masterchef in 2010, she also appeared on the third season of Canadian series Murdoch Mysteries after defeating Christine Hamilton and Dick Strawbridge in the competition’s final.

He co-hosted Matt Dawson’s ‘Real Food Family Cook-Off’ on Channel 5, co-hosted Ben Shephard’s ‘What’s Cooking?’ on Channel 4, and they once again worked together as co-hosts of ‘This Morning Summer’ in 2015.

In March 2017, she made her debut in “EastEnders” as Fi Browning, a “stylish and sophisticated” businesswoman.

Faulkner and John Torode have also been given a weekend cooking show, John and Lisa’s Weekend Cooking, which will air on ITV on Sunday mornings. With her friend Nicola Stephenson, Faulkner appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox in July 2019.
